llm.feedback: To reach world‑class quality, condense the draft into a 4–6 sentence, decision‑useful house view and fix the structure first: establish a tight 3‑regime core (A ≈ 50%, B ≈ 30%, C ≈ 20%) with a single price‑path narrative for each, tie Regime A to durable PV gains from AI steerability and stable policy, and keep B/C as the higher‑discount, higher‑cost scenarios; remove desconvoluted tangents and separate the medium/current pricing logic from longer‑horizon governance/nonpricing channels, which should be flagged as watch items rather than pricing signals; extract a concise catalysts/watch list with precise data anchors (GPT‑4o→GPT‑5 steerability, California private‑sector employment −3.1%, almond losses $109–$311m, UCLA suspended funding ~$584m, Paramount/Disney/Carano settlements) and assign sensible time windows; ensure every material claim is quantified with source IDs and that the horizon remains coherent (0–3 weeks for the Germany PMI strand links to the regime framework, while 12–24 months under Regime A anchors the AI productivity path); articulate explicit invalidation rules (e.g., PMI sustained below 50, Q2 revision worse than −0.3%, or AI adoption failing to yield measurable productivity gains within 3–5 years) and a disciplined watch‑list (AI steerability metrics, inflation/policy guidance, oil trajectory, and earnings revisions) with probabilities and a 12–24 month horizon; finally, tighten citations to only IDs present in SOURCE MATERIAL, remove placeholder tags like “SCRAP Source X” unless they are in the source set, and ensure coverage of critical sources (R3WNA7L7A, URA82RR2I, YQP2U687I, SCRAP Source 6/7, NL5YYTLF2, T1QE6JPIX, 52EQBV548, J99EM2TPZ).
